imageAlt: This is the periodic table example
title: Periodic table

areas.name: Alkali Metals
areas.areaDetails: These Group 1 metals are very reactive species that easily lose their one valence electron to form ionic compounds. These elements occur naturally in nature.

areas.name: Alkali Earth Metals
areas.areaDetails: These Group 2 metals are reactive species that lose their two valence electrons. They have a smaller atomic radii compared to alkali metals.

areas.name: Transition Metals
areas.areaDetails: These metals are high in density and have high melting points, and are good conductors of heat and electricity.

areas.name: Helogens
areas.areaDetails: Halogens have low melting and boiling points, they have high electronegativities, and are sparingly soluble in water. As you go down the periodic table, their atomic radii increases and reactivity and electronegativity decreases.

areas.name: Nobel gases
areas.areaDetails: Noble gases are odorless, colorless, and nonflammable gases that have low chemical reactivity. The full valence electron shells of these atoms make noble gases extremely stable and very unlikely to form chemical bonds.
